title: Scientific Approaches for a Sustainable Future: ADDIE-Bloom Integrated Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Project-based blended learning course for working professionals aiming to integrate scientific-social understanding of sustainability. Parallel online-offline activities using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can design sustainable problem-solving solutions at Bloom’s Taxonomy levels 4–6 (analysis-evaluation-creation).

Learners will plan one sustainable science content project following the five phases of the ADDIE model (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation) and submit a 3-page project proposal that reflects both local (South Korea) and global (UN SDGs) contexts.
Learners achieve a 20% or higher improvement in pre-post assessments addressing cognitive (knowledge) and affective (attitude) dimensions of sustainability issues.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
